subject: GDPR Audit Complete - MasterCalendar Backend
body:
Quinn,

Completed GDPR compliance audit of calendar-be-af. Summary for your awareness:

## Critical Finding

All analytics endpoints are PUBLIC (`authLevel: 'anonymous'`). Anyone can query user login history, IPs, locations by Firebase UID. Fulton is fixing this now.

## Task Assignments

| Owner | Task | Priority |
|-------|------|----------|
| **Fulton** | Add auth to analytics endpoints | P0 (critical) |
| **Fulton** | Remove PII from context.log | P0 |
| **Dash** | Add MongoDB TTL indexes (90 days) | P1 |
| **Dash** | Implement IP truncation | P1 |
| **Dash** | Create data export/delete endpoints | P2 |
| **Dash** | Regional privacy config | P3 |

## Regional Status

| Region | Compliance | Blocker |
|--------|------------|--------|
| EU (GDPR) | Non-compliant | Public endpoints, no retention limits, no consent |
| US (CCPA) | Partial | Need privacy policy, deletion process |
| APAC | Varies | China/Korea need data localization review |

## Data Currently Captured

- Full IP addresses (5 collections, indefinite)
- Firebase UIDs (4 collections, indefinite)
- Precise geolocation (4 collections, indefinite)
- Full User-Agent strings (4 collections, indefinite)
- FCM tokens (indefinite)

## Documentation

Full compliance guide: `calendar-be-af/docs/GDPR-COMPLIANCE.md`

Covers:
- Implementation code samples
- MongoDB TTL commands
- Regional requirements (EU vs US vs APAC)
- Priority checklist

## Your Role

Coordinate between Fulton (backend fixes) and Dash (compliance infra). Frontend may need updates for:
- Cookie consent banner
- Privacy policy links
- User data export/delete UI

Let me know if you need anything escalated.
